verses.text: In the \sc Lord\sc* put I my trust: How say ye to my soul, Flee \add as\add* a bird \add to\add* your mountain?
For lo, the wicked bend \add their\add* bow, They make ready their arrow upon the string, That \add they\add* may privily shoot at the upright in heart.
If the foundations be destroyed, What can the righteous do?
The \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* in his holy temple, The \sc Lordâ€™s\sc* throne \add is\add* in heaven: His eyes behold, His eyelids try, the children of men.
The \sc Lord\sc* trieth the righteous: But the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.
Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, And a horrible tempest: \add this shall be\add* the portion of their cup.
For the righteous \sc Lord\sc* loveth righteousness; His countenance doth behold the upright.
